resources.string: On some reservations, native women are murdered at a rate of 10 times the national average.
Between 2005–2009 U.S. attorneys declined to prosecute 67% of native community matters involving sexual abuse.
84% of Native women have experienced violence in their lifetime.
96% of sexual violence against native women is perpetrated by non-natives.

Please be respectful. 
 
This app\’s sole purpose is to bring awareness about #MMIWG2S. 
 
If you would like to support the movement and add your voice, then this is the app for you. 
 
To learn more, check out settings for links to more information. Thank you for your support."
Will you share with us too?

We plan to use the image in a collage to show the support for MMIW. We may use the email to send you messages about community events, alerts for missing women in your area, and to let you know how you can make a difference in MMIW.
To learn more about MMIW, please visit \nNational Indigenous Women\'s Resource Center awareness page
For families of missing Native relatives, please check out the MISTI workbook.
